result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L Hesse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit 154 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Remainder of fine to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department.  Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.
Complete GED or HSED.  Maintain employment.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Advise any treating physicians of drug use history before being prescribed any medications.  Ingest any of these medications only in the manner prescribed.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Complete Cognitive Intervention Counseling

No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

charges.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

Defendant Eric L Hesse in court, in custody, with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the PSI report.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Ritter makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 

Sentence of 
3 1/2 years Imprisonment (Credit - 154 days )
18 months of Initial Confinement
24 months of Extended Supervision

Conditions of extended superivision:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed
Advise any treating physicians of drug use history before being prescribed any medications.  Ingest any of these medications only in the manner prescribed
Complete Cognitivie Intervention Counseling
Complete GED or HSED
Maintain employment
FINE:  $2577.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $60.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  ## Police Department.
DL REVOCATION:  36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 
AODA Assessment and follow through
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
